ratings.comment: Debraj was a fine teacher. Was not an exciting lecturer, and was extremely hard to pay attention to at times; however, if you go through the lecture notes he posts online and/or just pay attention in class you should be fine. The grading is pretty easy.

Very unclear and confusing lectures. Debraj struggles to explain concepts in generic terms and basically just writes formulas on the board. Test and fair and very similar to the homework. Clearly a very nice guy, but not a great instructor.

Kind of all over the place, but he has potential to be good. Office hours are helpful. Exams were easy if you do the homework before it. Make sure to know the notations, and the class will make more sense. The average for the final was a 95%. Exams have 120 points on them but are out of 100, so no curve.

Professor Das is by far the worst professor/teacher I have ever had. He mumbles his prewritten lecture notes. Frequently gives us wrong equations that dont line up with his online notes leading us to question which one is correct. I called him hilarious because of how wrong he is in most of his lectures to the point where it is photo worthy.

Worst lectures I have ever attended. He mumbles and writes incoherent equations (horrible handwriting) without explaining anything. If you do not already know statistics abbreviations you will be lost. Do yourself a favor and buy the textbook, read it and do not bother with the lectures.

The material for the course is not very difficult, but he is so poor at teaching that hardly any of it was communicated during lecture. Would have been okay to teach myself using the fairly helpful textbook, but the exams had problems over material we'd never seen or worked before, and were 80% of the total grade. Would not recommend to anyone.

This was his first time teaching and it was evident, BUT he improved tremendously throughout the semester. He grades leniently, and the tests are not very difficult. He puts his lecture notes online, and he is clearly trying his best. Although not the best teacher ever, he wasn't horrible and is improving.
If you don't want to learn a single thing about statistics, take this professor

Would typically show up late and begin scribbling on the board with no explanantion. The concepts being taught arent overly difficult, but his method of explaining (and often lack thereof) is overly complex, jumbled, and completely ineffective. His attitude toward student questions is the worst Ive seen. This man was saved by his TAs.

Most days, he will show up to class late and then without saying a word and start writing equations on the board. Doesn't explain the notation or abbreviations he uses. Frequently corrected in class by students who took AP Stats. You get to teach yourself the homework. Learned nothing. Passed because of notesheets and an amazing TA. Drop or switch.

He basically just stands up there and mumbles his lecture notes verbatim, which seem to be taken in the same way from a textbook. Point values seem to be assigned at random in the homework. I suggest avoiding him at all possible

Lecture does nothing. All he does is stand in the front, mumbling the material until he gets though it. No emotion, no visual examples, no explaining. He simply write down the material in a very textbook (not easily understandable) manner. Overall just a very very very bad professor.
This dude is way to fast in his lectures and puts no emphasis on anything of importance. Just rambles for an hour with no examples or applications 0/10 stay away.
